com.github.clemp6r.futuroid

Interface Future<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the Future result type
    All Superinterfaces:
    Future<T>

    public interface Future<T>
extends Future<T>
    A Future represents the result of an asynchronous computation. It is returned by Async static methods. After a client gets a Future object, it can register listeners to be notified when the asynchronous computation is finished.
    See Also:
    Future

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCallback(FutureCallback<? super T> callback)
      Registers a callback that will be run on the UI/main thread.
      void addCallback(FutureCallback<? super T> callback, Executor executor)
      Registers a callback that will be run on the given executor.
      void addFailureCallback(FailureCallback callback)
      Registers a failure callback that will be run on the UI/main thread.
      void addSuccessCallback(SuccessCallback<? super T> callback)
      Registers a success callback that will be run on the UI/main thread.
      <U> Future<U> map(AsyncFunction<? super T,U> function)
      Returns a new Future whose result is asynchronously derived from the result of this Future.
      <U> Future<U> map(com.google.common.base.Function<? super T,U> function)
      Returns a new Future whose result is the product of applying the given Function to this Future.
      <U> Future<U> willReturn(U object)
      Transform this Future into another Future that will return the given object after completion.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.concurrent.Future

        cancel, get, get, isCancelled, isDone

    • Method Detail

      • addSuccessCallback

        void addSuccessCallback(SuccessCallback<? super T> callback)
        Registers a success callback that will be run on the UI/main thread. It will be called only if the asynchronous computation finishes without failure.

      • addFailureCallback

        void addFailureCallback(FailureCallback callback)
        Registers a failure callback that will be run on the UI/main thread. It will be called only if the asynchronous computation fails.

      • addCallback

        void addCallback(FutureCallback<? super T> callback)
        Registers a callback that will be run on the UI/main thread.

      • addCallback

        void addCallback(FutureCallback<? super T> callback,
               Executor executor)
        Registers a callback that will be run on the given executor.

      • map

        <U> Future<U> map(com.google.common.base.Function<? super T,U> function)
        Returns a new Future whose result is the product of applying the given Function to this Future.
        Type Parameters:
        U - the new result type
        Parameters:
        function - a function to transform the result of this Future

      • map

        <U> Future<U> map(AsyncFunction<? super T,U> function)
        Returns a new Future whose result is asynchronously derived from the result of this Future.
        Type Parameters:
        U - the new result type
        Parameters:
        function - a function to create a new Future from the result of this Future.

      • willReturn

        <U> Future<U> willReturn(U object)
        Transform this Future into another Future that will return the given object after completion.
        Type Parameters:
        U - the new result type
        Parameters:
        object - the object to return if this Future succeed
